description.p: You have dedicated years to mastering the lore of monsters from the ancient civilization to the present. Your tireless efforts have led you to scour countless manuscripts, study ancient scrolls, and learn from the greatest experts in your field. Through your rigorous studies, you have become a true master of monster behaviour and hunting techniques.

ul.li: Skill Proficiencies: Choose two from: Athletics, History, Insight, Investigation, Nature
Equipment: A bottle of ink, a quill, a small knife, a notebook containing your notes on creatures you have encountered or studied, a set of common clothes, and a pouch containing 10 gp

b.big: As a member of the Royal Paleontology Scriveners you are granted additional features:

select.name: Personality Trait
select.item: I am constantly seeking to learn more about the monsters I study.
I have a keen eye for detail and can notice subtle changes in monster behaviour.
I approach new information with a healthy dose of skepticism and always seek to verify its accuracy.
I can break complex information into its component parts and analyze it.
I pay attention to even the smallest details in my research and writing.
I've read every book in the world's greatest libraries- or I like to boast that I have.
I have learned that doing your research before a hunt leads to a safer hunt.
I take a methodical approach to my work and ensure that every aspect of a monster's behaviour is thoroughly documented.

select.name: Ideals
select.item: Knowledge. I believe that knowledge is the key to understanding and defeating monsters. (Neutral)
Preservation. I am committed to preserving the natural balance of the world and ensuring that monsters are not hunted to extinction. (Good)
Responsibility. It is my responsibility to share my knowledge of monsters with others in order to keep them safe. (Lawful Good)
Progress. I believe that there is always more to learn about monsters, and I am committed to pushing the boundaries of my field. (Chaotic)

Power. I believe that knowledge is power, and I seek to use my expertise to gain influence and control over others. I am willing to do whatever it takes to advance my own agenda and increase power. (Evil)
Truth. I believe in the importance of seeking out and sharing the truth about monsters, even if it is difficult or unpopular. (Neutral)

select.name: Bonds
select.item: My research is my life's work, and I will do anything to protect it.
I feel a deep sense of responsibility to use my knowledge to help others defeat monsters.
I am fiercly loyal to my colleagues and will do whatever it takes to help them in their research.
I have a deep respect for the traditions and history of monster hunting, and I am committed to preserving them.
I am motivated by a desire to uncover the secrets of the world and the creatures that inhabit it.
I have a personal connection to a particular monster or group of monsters, and I am driven to learn everything you can about them.

select.name: Flaws
select.item: My obsessive focus on research can make it difficult for me to form meaningful relationships with others.
I am prone to tunnel vision and may miss vital details in my research.
I can be dismissive of information that does not fit with with my preconceived notions about monsters.
My commitment to preserving monsters can sometimes put me at odds with others who believe they should be hunted and killed.
I can be single-minded in my pursuit of knowledge, even at the expense of my own safety.
My desire for knowledge can sometimes border on recklessness, as I willingly take risks to gather information about dangerous monsters.

description.p: Expanding the knowledge of your research is an important aspect of your job at the Royal Scriveners. When you discover new information about a creature related to your speciality, you can bring that information to a Royal Paleontology Sriveners owned location to recieve a stipend. Discuss with your DM what that amount is and if you can make more depending on what you discover or as you level up.
